results.headline: STRANGERS IN GOOD COMPANY (MOVIE)

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Company of Strangers

results.summary_short: When their tour bus breaks down, a group of elderly women are marooned together for several days. With an empty vacation house at hand, the experience turns into a bracing respite for the group, among them a Mohawk Indian matriarch and a Philadelphia-born lesbian. Fish get caught in pantyhose nets but nothing too dramatic happens, not that it matters. As they share their lives and memories, the women gradually take shape while Cynthia Scott's film moves at its own slow, peaceful pace and arrives at a gratifying destination.
